text: Joanna hit one something important - do a campaign strategy. I presume most places are looking to hire _Level 2_ or above thinkers (Elliot Jacques method). get them to commit to planning & seeing their process for how they look to get strategic alignment on content (against company pillars, customer needs) how they view distribution (paid owned earned) and the supporting tactics - not just if they are a great writer. I think that is often very revealing about who has aptitude and interest to do more than put their head down to write

text:
I recently hired for several content marketing roles (two were more traditional writers, another was for a podcast producer/webinar specialist).

Big caveat… we do not ask applicants to complete any assignment until they are very far along in the interview process (e.g., final round presentation & meeting with hiring manager + CMO).

For each candidate, we ask them to complete an assignment very close to the work they’d do if hired. For a more traditional content role, this is usually a blog outline & short post, which I’ve found helps highlight their thought process and ability to translate intentions to actual writing.

For the podcast role, we asked candidates to pitch episode concepts (speaker, topic, potential questions) based on a specified theme & audience.
